intro: Mapouria ptychophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed mapouria, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a small shrub characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically red when mature. Native to parts of Southeast Asia, it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. It is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories.
